author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
The former Rashtriya Janata Dal MP, Mohammed Shahabuddin, was granted bail on Wednesday by the Patna High Court in the case of murder of two brothers in 2004. A court in Siwan had awarded him life imprisonment.

Mohd. Shahabuddin is now lodged in the Siwan jail, with 20 cases pending against him.

Satish Raj, 25, and Girish Raj, 20, sons of Chandrakeshwar Prasad, a businessman, were kidnapped and killed on August 16, 2004. Their mother Kalawati Devi blamed the killings on Shahabuddin. The couple’s eldest son, Rajiv Roshan, 36, an eyewitness to the murder, was shot dead on June 16, 2014, allegedly by Shahabuddin’s men. Now, Chandrakeshwar Prasad and Kalawati Devi live in Siwan, with their other son Nitish Raj, who is differently-abled.
title: Shahabuddin gets bail in double-murder case
